question: "'The Doors' generated a controversy with the single ""Hello, I Love You"" in 1968 when the press pointed out it's resemblance to the 1965 hit ""All Day and All of the Night"" of which band?"
api_result: The band is "The Kinks." The controversy arose because "Hello, I Love You" by The Doors was said to bear a resemblance to "All Day and All of the Night" by The Kinks, a song that was released in 1965.
